# GCC Interactif [![tests](https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc/actions/workflows/main.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc/actions/workflows/main.yml) [![contrib](https://img.shields.io/badge/contributions-welcome-brightgreen.svg?style=flat)](https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc/issues) [![Code style: black](https://img.shields.io/badge/code%20style-black-000000.svg)](https://github.com/psf/black) > [!NOTE] > Le d√©p√¥t original d‚ÄôAndy Balaam se trouve ici : https://codeberg.org/andybalaam/igcc.

RowTranslations.originContent: > The original repo from Andy Balaam is here: https://codeberg.org/andybalaam/igcc.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: > Le d√©p√¥t original d‚ÄôAndy Balaam se trouve ici : https://codeberg.org/andybalaam/igcc.

Content:
> In this fork, I've done some refactoring and tried to make it easier to use.

> [!WARNING]
> This project is a hacky attempt at getting a shorter feedback loop when working with C/C++ in some cases and it's obviously not intended for anything serious.

Interactive GCC (`igcc`) is a read-eval-print loop (REPL) for C/C++. It works by manipulating a base source file with user commands, compiles the source after each modification, then executes the resulting binary and collects its stdout & stderr.
Multi-line (block) input is supported, so you can add multiple lines in one go and invoke the compiler just once (examples below).

You can include various header files. For convenience, a default header is included: [`boilerplate.h`](https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc/blob/main/igcc/assets/boilerplate.h). Also, `using namespace std;` is not available by default, but you can explicitly add it (example below).

Various aspects of `igcc` can be configured, see [`config.yaml`](https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc/blob/main/igcc/assets/config.yaml).

## Getting started
The easiest way to get started is to use [pipx](https://pipx.pypa.io/stable/):
Translation:
> Dans ce fork, j'ai effectu√© quelques refactorisations et essay√© de le rendre plus facile √† utiliser.

> [!AVERTISSEMENT]
> Ce projet est une tentative bricol√©e pour obtenir une boucle de r√©troaction plus courte lors du travail avec C/C++ dans certains cas, et il n'est √©videmment pas destin√© √† un usage s√©rieux.

GCC interactif (`igcc`) est une boucle read-eval-print (REPL) pour C/C++. Il fonctionne en manipulant un fichier source de base via les commandes utilisateur, compile la source apr√®s chaque modification, puis ex√©cute le binaire r√©sultant et collecte sa sortie standard et son erreur standard.
L'entr√©e multi-lignes (bloc) est prise en charge, vous pouvez donc ajouter plusieurs lignes d'un coup et invoquer le compilateur une seule fois (exemples ci-dessous).

Vous pouvez inclure divers fichiers d'en-t√™te. Pour plus de commodit√©, un en-t√™te par d√©faut est inclus : [`boilerplate.h`](https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc/blob/main/igcc/assets/boilerplate.h). De plus, `using namespace std;` n'est pas disponible par d√©faut, mais vous pouvez l'ajouter explicitement (exemple ci-dessous).

Divers aspects de `igcc` peuvent √™tre configur√©s, voir [`config.yaml`](https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc/blob/main/igcc/assets/config.yaml).

## Pour commencer
La fa√ßon la plus simple de commencer est d'utiliser [pipx](https://pipx.pypa.io/stable/) :

RowTranslations.originContent: The easiest way to get started is to use [pipx](https://pipx.pypa.io/stable/):
RowTranslations.translatedContent: La fa√ßon la plus simple de commencer est d'utiliser [pipx](https://pipx.pypa.io/stable/) :

Content:
```
pipx install git+https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc.git
```
Translation:
```
pipx install git+https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc.git
```

Content: Alternatively, you can also use `uv`:
Translation: Vous pouvez √©galement utiliser `uv`¬†:

Content:
```
uv tool run git+https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc
```
Translation:
```
uv tool run git+https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc
```

Content: And for dev:
Translation: Et pour le d√©veloppement :

Content:
```
git clone https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc.git
cd igcc
uv sync
```
Translation:
```
git clone https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc.git
cd igcc
uv sync
```

Content:
Available args:
<!-- MDUP:BEG uv run igcc --help -->
Translation:
Arguments disponibles :
<!-- MDUP:BEG uv run igcc --help -->

Content:
```
usage: igcc [-h] [-I INCLUDE [INCLUDE ...]] [-L LIBDIR [LIBDIR ...]]
            [-l LIB [LIB ...]]

options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -I INCLUDE [INCLUDE ...]
                        Add INCLUDE to the list of directories to be searched
                        for header files.
  -L LIBDIR [LIBDIR ...]
                        Add LIBDIR to the list of directories to be searched
                        for library files.
  -l LIB [LIB ...]      Search the library LIB when linking.
```
Translation:
```
usage: igcc [-h] [-I INCLUDE [INCLUDE ...]] [-L LIBDIR [LIBDIR ...]]
            [-l LIB [LIB ...]]

options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -I INCLUDE [INCLUDE ...]
                        Add INCLUDE to the list of directories to be searched
                        for header files.
  -L LIBDIR [LIBDIR ...]
                        Add LIBDIR to the list of directories to be searched
                        for library files.
  -l LIB [LIB ...]      Search the library LIB when linking.
```

RowTranslations.translatedContent: -h, --help            show this help message and exit

RowTranslations.originContent: Add INCLUDE to the list of directories to be searched
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Add INCLUDE to the list of directories to be searched

RowTranslations.originContent: Add LIBDIR to the list of directories to be searched

Content:
<!-- MDUP:END -->

The code will be compiled with GCC (`g++`) and the results (if any) will be displayed.
Type `.h` for help:
Translation:
<!-- MDUP:END -->

Le code sera compil√© avec GCC (`g++`) et les r√©sultats (le cas √©ch√©ant) seront affich√©s.
Tapez `.h` pour obtenir de l'aide :

RowTranslations.originContent: The code will be compiled with GCC (`g++`) and the results (if any) will be displayed.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Le code sera compil√© avec GCC (`g++`) et les r√©sultats (le cas √©ch√©ant) seront affich√©s.

Content:
```
$ igcc
[1]> .h
.h  Show this help message
.e  Show the last compile errors/warnings
.l  List the code you have entered
.L  List the whole program as given to the compiler
.r  Redo undone command
.u  Undo previous command
.q  Quit
```
Translation:
```
$ igcc
[1]> .h
.h  Show this help message
.e  Show the last compile errors/warnings
.l  List the code you have entered
.L  List the whole program as given to the compiler
.r  Redo undone command
.u  Undo previous command
.q  Quit
```

Content: ## Examples
Translation: ## Exemples

Content: **Multi-line input** is supported (check `multiline_marker` from config). The benefit is avoiding multiple compiler calls.
Translation: **L'entr√©e multi-lignes** est prise en charge (v√©rifiez `multiline_marker` dans la configuration). L'avantage est d'√©viter plusieurs appels au compilateur.

Translation: Vous pouvez inclure des en-t√™tes :

Content: Libs can be linked:
Translation: Les biblioth√®ques peuvent √™tre li√©es :

Content: You can also **undo** commands:
Translation: Vous pouvez √©galement **annuler** les commandes :

Content: ... or **redo** previously undone commands:
Translation: ... ou **refaire** des commandes pr√©c√©demment annul√©es :

Content:
## Future work
See https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc/issues

## Similar projects
- https://github.com/BenBrock/reple: "Replay-based" REPLs for compiled languages
- https://github.com/root-project/cling: The cling C++ interpreter
